title: JILL SCOTT: We must go back to basics at Manchester City in order to halt slump
text:
It seems everything that could go wrong is going wrong at the moment for us at Manchester City.

First the late draw with Atletico Madrid in the Champions League, then it was confirmed Aoife Mannion had suffered an ACL injury.

Following on was the defeat to Manchester United in the Continental Cup. As if that result wasn’t tough enough — we lost Keira Walsh to a straight red card with 20 minutes to go. Now we’re without a win in three games after Sunday’s defeat at Arsenal in the FA Women’s Super League.

As a group, we simply must go back to basics after the 1-0 defeat by Arsenal

It’s not the first time I have experienced moments like this. Back in 2016 — the year we won the title — we had a bare XI, plus some development players on the bench.

We didn’t have luck on our side but still got our hands on the trophy. Times like these can help build belief.

I remember coming to Meadow Park in my early 20s when I was playing for Everton. I was on the end of some heavy defeats and it hurt so much I even contemplated retirement, despite still being very young.

Last season when Arsenal lifted the title in front of their home fans after our 1-0 defeat, it felt like we’d all been invited to a party we didn’t want to attend. They had won the title before a ball had been kicked.

A strike from Vivianne Miedema was enough for Arsenal to secure a 1-0 win over Man City

It’s the moment I used to try and drive us on. Sometimes you need to go through those experiences. Arsenal’s Vivianne Miedema is a forward who drifts in and out of a game.

She’s not like City’s England striker Ellen White, who will hunt down defenders, but has such an eye for goal. Give her time and space and you know Miedema is going to find the back of the net.

We got punished for doing just that, just before half-time. We have to be on it in every game in this League but perhaps we haven’t been of late. It’s time to get back to basics. Our defensive shape was better against Arsenal but we paid the price for not creating enough opportunities.

White was one of our biggest signings this summer and it was great to see her come on as a sub in the second half, but we can’t pile pressure on her. Ellen’s been out for a few months and it would be unfair to expect instant results.

We have to create more chances if we’re going to get a win against Atletico Madrid in the second leg of our last 16 tie on Wednesday. Win in Spain and it will give the team that little bit of extra belief.

As told to Claire Bloomfield
